metadata.Title: CVE-2022-23218 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: The deprecated compatibility function svcunix_create in the sunrpc module of the GNU C Library (aka glibc) through 2.34 copies its path argument on the stack without validating its length, which may result in a buffer overflow, potentially resulting in a denial of service or (if an application is not built with a stack protector enabled) arbitrary code execution.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Ubuntu has stack protector enabled since 2006, so this issue is only a denial of service.

criterions.comment: glibc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
